title: Bug 50059: Resources not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml
description:
Bug 50059: Resources are not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml. 

To reproduce the issue, create a Servlet 3.0 web application called 'foo' with the metadatacomplete="true" attribute set on the 'web-app' element in the /WEB-INF/web.xml file.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start the web application in Tomcat 7.0.2.
2. Open a browser and go to http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html.

Expected result: 
Receive a 200 response and index.html should be served.

Actual result: 
Receive a 404 error.

If you modify the web.xml file to set metadatacomplete="false" and restart the application, now accessing /foo/index.html will respond as expected.

I also tested the same web application with Glassfish v3.0.1, and it works as expected regardless of the value set in the metadatacomplete attribute.

Upon reviewing the Servlet 3.0 specification, it appears that the metadatacomplete attribute only regulates annotation and web fragment processing. In this case, even though the 'bar.jar' file has no annotations and is not a web fragment, it is still handled differently depending on the value of the metadatacomplete attribute.
OB: Start the web application in Tomcat 7.0.2 and access http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html. The expected result is a successful 200 response and index.html should be served.
EB: If the web.xml file is modified to set metadatacomplete="false" and the application is restarted, accessing /foo/index.html should respond as expected.
